item.title: Astroquery -- New Service Atomic Line List
item.description: The new support for the service will allow the user to ...
item.dc:creator: Simon Liedtke

item.title: Bonding Period is Over
item.description:
The last week has officially been the so-called "community bonding period". I used it to get more familiar with the codebase, hang around on #astropy and follow the development via the mailinglist and the updates of the astroquery repository at GitHub. My next plans are:

  • to finally finish my started …
item.dc:creator: Simon Liedtke

item.title: End of Google Summer of Code
item.description: GSoC is over. I'm glad to have participated. I will continue contributing to the SunPy project and even consider mentoring next year.
item.dc:creator: Simon Liedtke

item.title: Week 11 — Support for the VSO attributes Wave and Time
item.description: The attribute Wave now searches all entries and converts wavelengths from the given unit to nm, if necessary. A new attribute that is now supported is Time.
item.dc:creator: Simon Liedtke

item.title: Week 10 — Extracting waveunit from FITS files
item.description: This week I worked on a seperate git branch to submit a pull request. I added a feature to extract the wavelength unit being used from a FITS header.
item.dc:creator: Simon Liedtke

item.title: Week 9 — Improved Database class
item.description: The Database class has been extended by the methods add_from_path and add_from_vso_query_result and set_cache_size. All these methods can be undone using the undo method. The query method now also supports the attributes Path, DownloadTime and FitsHeaderEntry.
item.dc:creator: Simon Liedtke

item.title: Week 8 — Various new features
item.description: In this week I added different new features for which I can't find one headline. The slicing syntax for Database and the function display_entries have been implemented thanks to one of my mentors, Steven Christe. Thank you for the ideas!
item.dc:creator: Simon Liedtke

item.title: Week 7 — Announcement: a week of vacation
item.description: I'll be on vacation from July 20 — 27.
item.dc:creator: Simon Liedtke

item.title: Week 6 — Querying the database
item.description: It is now possible to query the database.
item.dc:creator: Simon Liedtke

item.title: Week 5 — Importing database entries from a directory
item.description: A new feature is to make new database entries from a given directory.
item.dc:creator: Simon Liedtke

item.title: Week 4 — Plans for query support
item.description: One big feature that is still missing is querying the database, i.e. reading from the databaase by sending queries. In this post, I will share my ideas and plans to implement this feature.
item.dc:creator: Simon Liedtke

item.title: Week 3 — Tag Support
item.description: It is now possible to assign tags to entries.
item.dc:creator: Simon Liedtke

item.title: Week 2 — Database Entries
item.description: The class DatabaseEntry is the main table in the database. Each instance of it is an entry in the database and contains all relevant information in its attributes.
item.dc:creator: Simon Liedtke

item.title: Week 1 — The Database class
item.description: The class Database is the central element of the project I am working on. It is responsible for connecting to the database, manipulation entries and reading from it.
item.dc:creator: Simon Liedtke

item.title: GSOC 2013 — Initial Post
item.description: I have found out that I am accepted for GSOC and am pretty excited!
item.dc:creator: Simon Liedtke
